intro: Nasa ranunculifolia subsp. ranunculifolia, commonly known as the "moonflower," is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and thrives in cool, humid environments. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
